set.name: Timberland Earthkeepers®
set.description:
Get to know the boot that changed the way Timberland thinks about its products - our flagship [Earthkeepers®](https://www.timberland.com/shop/mens-earthkeepers-original-leather-6-inch-boots-brown-15551210) men's boots. Everyone thought we were crazy when we set out to create our most eco-conscious boot in 2007. It seemed impossible at the time to make a boot that left a lighter footprint on the Earth we walk on. But that’s exactly what we did. This one boot transformed the way we think about how we make our products, and inspired us to walk the talk beyond just one boot by building sustainability into all of our products. Explore the map to learn more!


DATA AS OF JULY 2018

FEATURES
Click the icons below to reveal unique features of our supply chain. Each element will highlight the facilities whose practices fall under one of the designated categories:

things.name: Tyson Amarillo Hide & Tannery
things.description:
Number of Operators: 51
Total Number of Employees: 138
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 98% Male, 2% Female
Certifications: LWG Gold Rated (Traceability Physical: 100%, Traceability Paper: 0%); Certified Angus, BRC Certification; Laboratory Certification for biological and chemical testing
Produced Here: Wet Blue Hides

Tyson Amarillo Hide & Tannery participates in the following programs that improve their worker safety and support children in their local communities:

I Got Your Back: A program to empower team members to identify and intervene in unsafe behaviors and conditions to reduce injuries in a positive way.
Fab 12: A program to provide training and awareness of hazards and how to respond.
Helping Hands: A program to help team members financially in times of need.
Dekra Training: A program to educate managers on leadership principles used to build a safety knowledge base and foster a strong safety culture.
Christmas Tree Angels: A program to help local children during the Christmas Season.
March Of Dimes: Fundraisers and activities to increase awareness of the battle against this childhood disease.
Health, Safety and Ergo Fairs: Events to draw attention to and educate our team members to improve their wellness, personal safety and avoidance of repetitive motion illness.
AISD Partnership: Fundraising and collaboration to assist local schools in communication between our team members and their children’s teachers and counselors.

#community
things.foot_note: Information provided by supplier, not verified by VF.

things.name: Timberland DC
things.address: 3950 E Airport Dr, Ontario, CA 91761, USA
things.description:
Number of Operators: 89
Total Number of Employees: 107
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 36% Male, 64% Female
Certifications: N/A
Brands Handled: Timberland

The Timberland DC has implemented recycling programs, and is currently less than 1% away from qualifying as a zero waste facility. They have also installed a large solar array that provides approximately 40-50% of their total power usage. This facility allocates 20-40 hours of paid community service per year, based on employee hire date.

The Timberland DC began operation in April 1998, and produced 9.5M units in 2017.

#energyefficiency
things.foot_note: All information has been verified by VF.
